results.title: Family camping
results.creator_credit: Edmund Reid and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: For the family on a camping vacation for the first time, or even for the experienced camper, this color film is a congenial and informative guide. It shows popular forms of camping: site camping; a hiking trip; canoe camping in the backwoods; cruise camping through more travelled waters; and trail riding in the Rockies. Each is seen to have its own attractions.

results.title: Family
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Cherry, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Rebecca has been involved in various capacities in Legacy since her father died when she was seven. Rebecca talks about the different families in her life, especially the one she has found at Legacy. She has gone from being a Rotary Exchange student to a Legacy leader.

results.title: Family
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: Focusing on a typical nuclear family living in semi-rural Connecticut farmland, the role of the family in contemporary society is reviewed here. Members of this and other families give their views on marriage and family life, some upholding traditional views and others expressing discontent with the established system.
results.description: Focusing on a typical nuclear family living in semi-rural Connecticut farmland, the role of the family in contemporary society is reviewed here. Members of this and other families give their views on marriage and family life, some upholding traditional views and others expressing discontent with the established system.

results.title: Families: teaching and learning
results.brief_description: Shows the different things learnt through instruction and observation by the American, Japanese and Mexican children of the families introduced in the film “Families: alike and different”.

results.title: Families: food and eating
results.creator_credit: James Kennedy, Jane Treiman, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Shows how the three families introduced in “Families: alike and different” obtain, prepare and eat their food. The Japanese buy in small shops and use chopsticks to eat fish, lotus root and rice. The Mexicans use a market and their own garden and use fingers to eat chicken stew. The Americans use cutlery to eat chicken, corn and salad from a supermarket.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Kennedy, Jane Treiman, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films

results.title: Families: earning and spending
results.creator_credit: James Kennedy, Jane Treiman, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Shows the ways in which the three families introduced in the film “Families: alike and different” earn money and how they spend it on a variety of goods and services. The American parents work at separate jobs, the Mexican family is involved in the processing coffee beans and the Japanese father does research into water pollution.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Kennedy, Jane Treiman, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films

results.title: Families: alike and different
results.creator_credit: James Kennedy, Jane Treiman, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Compares the daily activities of three families from Japan, Mexico and the United States as told by the children. Shows the settings in which they live: a crowded Tokyo home, the San Francisco hills and the expansive rural three house compound of Yasalon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Kennedy, Jane Treiman, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films

results.title: Families get angry
results.creator_credit: Delton Cook, John Simons and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: A family quarrel begins when the father in a black, low-income family is trying to stretch too little money to pay too many bills. The two children are strongly affected by their parents’ conflict.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Delton Cook, John Simons and Oxford Films (U.S.)

results.title: Families and life
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Shaw, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A letter to her family and future generations, Suzanne tells of her family history, especially of her father and husband in war and how Legacy helped her with her grief and loss and helped her to move forward with her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Suzanne Shaw, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
